instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3787: What is 820-3787? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.3V3_S5: What is 3V3_S5? 3V3_S5 and PP3V3_S5 are interchangeable, see definition for PP3V3_S5. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S3</SIGNAL> missing
threads.message:
Hello

This machine was working fine until i disassembled it and replaced the display. There was a fair bit of dust and debris inside and I found corrosion around <CHIP>U5420</CHIP>. I removed the corrosion and reflowed the area and <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S3</SIGNAL> is still missing (0v). Power adapter is 18.5V @ 20ma. Where do I go from here?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S3</SIGNAL> missing
threads.message:
Be sure to use original 85W Magsafe 2 charger.
This board will not turn on with 45/60W charger; unless battery is connected and holds some charge.

Test the board alone on the desk, without any peripheral connected.
Do you get <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL>/SUS?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S3</SIGNAL> missing
threads.message:
Thank you. 

I connectectd original 85W and board turns on but no image on screen and fans spin full blast.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S3</SIGNAL> missing
threads.message:
Do you get USB activity?
Check if fans run normal when disconnect webcam.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S3</SIGNAL> missing
threads.message: Webcam is disconnected. Only Magsafe and LVDS display connector attached, board is out of case on desk. Fans spin up after magsafe connected, then turn off after 8 seconds or so, then turn on again and ramp up to full blast. No image, USB power but no acivity to drive connected.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S3</SIGNAL> missing
threads.message:
Check for knocked off components, or scratched/broken traces.
Test the board without LCD; just check USB activity.
